SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

cs113.calendar.model
Interface Backend

All Known Implementing Classes:
SerializableBackend
public interface Backend

Loads and stores all application data. Concrete implementations of this interface define where the data is actually stored. Constructing code is responsible for invoking the writeAll() method prior to destroying this object or exiting the program.

Author:
Michael Koval

Method Detail

createUser

User createUser(java.lang.String id,
                java.lang.String name)
                throws DuplicateUserIdException,
                       java.lang.NullPointerException
Constructs an abstract User object of the subclass corresponding with this model. Does not add this user to the model unless explicitly stored with the writeUser() method.

Parameters:
id - id that uniquely identifies the newly-created user
name - full name of the newly-created user
Returns:
new user object
Throws:
DuplicateUserIdException
java.lang.NullPointerException

createAppointment

Appointment createAppointment(java.lang.String desc,
                              java.lang.String loc,
                              java.util.Calendar start,
                              java.util.Calendar end)
                              throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                     InvalidDateException
Constructs an abstract Appointment object of the subclass corresponding with this model. Does not add this appointment to the model unless explicitly added to a user object.

Parameters:
desc - short description of this appointment or an empty string to indicate that there is no description
loc - location where this appointment occurs or null if this appointment is not related to any specific location
start - starting date and time of the appointment
end - ending date and time of the appointment, must occur after the starting time of the appointment
Returns:
new appointment object
Throws:
InvalidDateException - if the start time occurs after the end time of this appointment.
java.lang.NullPointerException

getUserIds

java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getUserIds()
Gets a list of all existing user IDs stored to disk.

Returns:
list of existing user IDs

readUser

User readUser(java.lang.String id)
              throws StorageException,
                     java.util.NoSuchElementException
Read a user from storage from disk into memory based upon the user's id.

Parameters:
id - user id that uniquely identifies the desired user
Returns:
user object associated with the given user id
Throws:
java.util.NoSuchElementException - thrown if there is no user with the desired user id
StorageException - if there is a problem storing it.

writeUser

void writeUser(User user)
               throws StorageException,
                      ModelMismatchException
Writes the provided user to a persistent data source. This method is implementation-defined and the write operation may or may not be immediately executed. The implicit contract of this method, however, guarantees that the user will be written to disk before the application terminates.

Parameters:
user - user to store in the persistent data source.
Throws:
StorageException - if there is a problem storing it.
ModelMismatchException

writeAll

void writeAll()
              throws StorageException
Forces all data writes that may be queued by the writeUser() method to be written to the persistent data source.

Throws:
StorageException - if there is a problem writing stuff.

deleteUser

void deleteUser(User user)
                throws ModelMismatchException
Remove the provided user object from the disk's session-persistent storage.

Parameters:
user - user to delete from disk
Throws:
ModelMismatchException
